content.contentTitle: School of Computing and Augmented Intelligence
content.contentDesc: Collaborated with Dr Jaejong Baek as a Teaching Assistant for the course CSE 543: Information Assurance & Security. Designed Capture The Flag challenges using C, involving binary exploitation, reverse engineering & network security.

Engineered performant RESTful microservices for payment & order processing handling 10,000+ transactions daily. Integrated JWT and OAuth to strengthen system security and minimize unauthorized access attempts. Implemented containerization & orchestration strategies to optimize resource management, reducing usage by 25%. Developed 15+ front-end features for user dashboards using React and D3.js to visualize sales and user engagement. Built CI/CD pipelines using Jenkins, to automate deployment and feature rollouts, saving 50 developer hours monthly. Applied Agile methodologies, best practices & code reviews to improve reliability, reducing post-release defects by 50%.

Initiated and integrated Solidity smart contracts to enable ERC-721 token minting, auctions, and trades. Remodeled REST APIs to improve system performance and scalability, achieving sub-50ms latency in API calls. Deployed targeted solutions to mitigate spam & reduce DDoS/DoS risks, lowering weekly call-center costs by $2000. Collaborated with cross-functional teams to build a frontend interface using React, boosting user engagement by 40%.
Developed a multitier web application enhancing user experience & engaging 63K users within the first month of launch.

Architected an elastic cloud application using AWS EC2 & SQS, capable of handling 10,000+ concurrent requests. Orchestrated a REST API for image recognition, utilizing deep learning models & returning results in under 80 ms. Programmed a custom auto-scaling algorithm, slashing down resource costs by 20% during low-traffic periods

Architected a secure banking application enabling account creation, transfers, and balance management in real-time. Set up Postgres database, created database schemas & optimized queries to achieve faster information retrieval.

content.contentTitle: Graph Data Analytics on NYC Taxi Data
content.contentDesc: Created a Docker container to deploy a Neo4j instance and loaded NYC Taxi data as a graph to extract insights. Implemented PageRank & Breadth First Search algorithms to identify the most frequently used pickup & dropoff locations, and to determine optimal routes between locations based on trip connectivity.

Fabricated smart contracts to record & manage the transfer of evidence custody, ensuring transparent storage. Designed a command-line tool using Python integrated with Web3.js reducing time for evidence retrieval by 40%.

I went to ASU and studied Computer Science. Relevant Coursework: Cloud Computing, Information Assurance and Security, Advanced Computer Network Security, Software Security, Computer and Network Forensics, Data Processing at Scale, Served as an teaching assistant for CSE 543 (Information Assurance and Security) for two straight semesters. GPA: 4.00.

I went to JECRC and studied Computer Science and Engineering. Relevant Coursework: Data Structures, Advanced Algorithms, Object-Oriented Programming, Distributed Software Development, Databases, Compilers, Operating Systems, Computer Architecture. GPA: 3.42.

Kanishk and his team skillfully managed the development of our website, navigating challenging tasks such as creating a user interface with intricate 3D representation of bike models and dynamic, sophisticated animations. Their commitment ensured timely delivery, and Kanishk's exceptional work with the anti-spam API showcased remarkable precision and expertise.

Exceptional performance! Kanishk is a dedicated and meticulous software developer who surpassed expectations. All tasks were completed promptly and with precision. His stellar communication skills further enriched the process. Overall, I highly recommend Kanishk as a proficient software developer.
